alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Nemaha (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 30 at 10:17PM CDT until May 31 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Until 7 AM CDT Tuesday * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...for portions of central Kansas, east central Kansas, north central Kansas, and northeast Kansas, including the following areas, in central Kansas, Dickinson. In east central Kansas, Geary, Lyon, Morris, Osage, Shawnee, and Wabaunsee. In north central Kansas, Clay. In northeast Kansas, Brown, Jackson, Jefferson, Marshall, Nemaha, Pottawatomie, and Riley. * WHEN...Until 7 AM Tuesday * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts of two to three inches are expected to be common from late tonight through Tuesday morning. Locally higher amounts are possible.
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
